intro: Crateva caffra, commonly known as the African arrowroot or sour fig, is a tropical shrub native to Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are often used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Its roots are also utilized for their starchy properties, making it an important plant in local communities. Crateva caffra thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
